text.0: sing to the troop that pours down rain in common the mighty company of celestial nature.
text.1: they make the worldhalves tremble with their greatness from depths of earth and sky they reach to heaven.
text.2: yea your birth maruts was with wild commotion ye who move swiftly fierce in wrath terrific.
text.3: ye allsurpassing in your might and vigour each looker on the light fears at your coming.
text.4: give ample vital power unto our princes let our fair praises gratify the maruts.
text.5: as the way travelled helpeth people onward so further us with your delightful succours.
text.6: your favoured singer counts his wealth by hundreds the strong steed whom ye favour wins a thousand.
text.7: the sovran whom ye aid destroys the foeman may this your gift ye shakers be distinguished.
text.8: i call as such the sons of bounteous rudra will not the maruts turn again to usward.
text.9: what secret sin or open stirs their anger that we implore the swift ones to forgive us.
text.10: this eulogy of the bounteous hath been spoken accept ye maruts this our hymn of praises.
text.11: ye bulls keep those who hate us at a distance preserve us evermore ye gods with blessings.
